content:
We will not actually merge this one yet, we're not quite at the release of v4.8.0-rc1, but hopefully that will come in the next few days.

Everything in this PR in principal has already been reviewed. However I'm pretty confident that sometime in the last two months (since it last diverged from master) I have done something shockingly stupid with git, so I'd like to go over the diff one last time. Others are very welcome to do the same! :-)
+1,436 −1,695 :flushed:
It seems like some fraction of changes can be backported; I'll try to make some time for that
From the first 100 files: #12549 for bors into master and #12550 for manual merge into bump/v4.8.0
Thanks @Ruben Van de Velde, those are very helpful!
I'll push some more later tonight

Ruben Van de Velde said:

I'll push some more later tonight

#12562
Does anyone recognise what has happened in Mathlib/Logic/IsEmpty.lean?
Isn't (∃ (_ : α), IsEmpty β) ↔ Nonempty α ∧ IsEmpty β already provable by simp?
I haven't seen a lint error for this.
Shall I just try reverting the change to Mathlib/Logic/IsEmpty.lean, and see if everything still works. I can't work out why that diff would be here.
Yeah, at worse it's very easy to do the change on master. That lemma is used only once or twice in all of mathlib (I believe I added it)
Did you add it on nightly-testing? I'm confused how this new lemma came into existence on this branch.
No, I meant the existing lemma. I didn't touch nightly-testing
Okay, I've removed the changes to Mathlib/Logic/IsEmpty, it seems to have no effect, and I can't work out why it was there.
I've now gone through the entire diff in #12548, and think I recognise everything.
We still have three PRs with bors #12577, #12476, #12578 after which we'll want to merge master back into bump/v4.8.0.
Then there are a few more minor changes on nightly-testing for nightly-2024-05-01.
And we need to run !bench on #12548 once it goes green.
#12584 should reduce the diff a bit more
